data.title: Agency Funds
data.meta_description: An agency endowment is a safe and simple way for a nonprofit organization to invest in its future.  You can focus on your core mission, while we provide professional investment expertise, endowment marketing support, and complex gift acceptance to help grow your endowment.
data.text:
The YWCA Quincy chose to open a fund with the Community Foundation in 2007 in response to a board member's requests that in lieu of gifts or accolades, they would rather have their Board service commemorated through a donation to an endowment with the Community Foundation.

After allocating a portion of a private bequest to start the endowment, the YWCA has since celebrated the work of women in the community by building the YWCA- Quincy Fund in this manner.

From new playground equipment to classroom chairs and supplies, since 2015 Friends of Unit 4 has helped bridge the funding gap that exists between school district needs in the northwestern portion of Adams County, Illinois and available funding.

The Friends of Unit 4 Fund, established in 2017, provides an additional avenue for gifts from donors who wish to support Unity Schools. The fund will provide a permanent source of funding to ensure the district’s students are provided opportunities to learn and thrive.

If you’re interested in starting a Designated Agency Endowment Fund, we’ll work with you step-by-step to reach your goal. Please contact us to get started.
